title: Kevin Costner reveals the true reason he endorsed Liz Cheney: 'I knew she would lose, but...'
description:
The season premiere of Yellowstone is this Sunday. Kevin Costner plays John Dutton, who gets elected governor. But it wasn't the first time Costner has been involved in politics this year. You all remember this unfortunate photo where Kevin Costner endorsed Liz Cheney in her primary.

Y'all know the story with Liz. She joined the January 6th committee. Her constituents were pissed about it. They endorsed another candidate who jollystomped her in a primary. As of January first, Liz Cheney is gone to start her new career as an MSNBC contributor or something.

Why did Costner make the endorsement, though? That's the question and USA Today got the answer. I'm linking to Whiskey Riff instead since I like them more.

Just because you lose doesn’t mean you’re done; it doesn’t mean you’re even wrong. I was clear that (Cheney) probably wasn’t going to win her election. But I wanted to let her know, as a citizen, how much I appreciated her brave, clear-headed stance.

C'mon, dude.

I never had the bandwidth to have strong opinions about a congresswoman from Wyoming. I got redistricted three times this year in my own state and had a hard enough time worrying about my own representation. But Liz is most definitely done. At least in politics. Cheney can still make some coin as an MSNBC News contributor.

And the bars about Cheney being "brave" and "clear-headed" is silly and why people roll their eyes when actors say something other than the lines written for them. There is nothing brave about a Republican doing what a Democrat and/or the media want them to. It's the easy way.

It would have been more convincing if Costner had said "I wore it because my agent thought it would be a good PR move."

Editor’s Note

title: 10-year-old gropes an adult school counselor and she's filing criminal charges. Yes, against the 10-year-old.
description:
A friend sent me this story and I thought it was another pedo teacher touching a student. There are an abnormal amount of stories like that. Granted, more than zero is an abnormal amount. No, this is a ten-year-old student who, allegedly, groped a teacher. And the teacher is pressing charges. Criminal charges. Against a ten-year-old.

The content created by NBC News is as follows. A Florida school counselor was visiting Holly Hill School. A ten-year-old student asked to give her a hug. The counselor turned sideways to give a side hug, and while the child put one arm around her shoulder he used his other hand to reach out and grab her left breast. She removed the hand from her breast and walked away.

Police were called because of this alleged misdemeanor. The 10-year-old, we'll call him Little Timmy, received a ten-day suspension from school and is facing a charge of misdemeanor battery. Little Timmy's parents deny the allegations, as does Little Timmy. Little Timmy's parents and their lawyers are fighting the charge.

Is it possible that Little Timmy did, in fact, grab the boobie?

Yes. And let me be the first to tell you, grabbing a boobie without permission is bad. It's inappropriate. Had Little Timmy grabbed the boobie, consequences are warranted. AGE APPROPRIATE consequences. A school meeting with his parents. Possibly making Little Timmy write "I will not grab boobies without permission" 100 times.

Charging the TEN-YEAR-OLD with a misdemeanor is a bit much. If I were to guess, the counselor has purple hair, claims to smash the patriarchy, and voted for Charlie Crist last Tuesday.

Editor’s Note

title: Our favorite chesty shop teacher is BACK and the school board ruled in HER favor (fake nipples and all)
description:
Out of all the beautiful bravery out on these streets, no one exemplifies that brave beauty as much as Kayla Lemieux. Our favorite fake-chested shop teacher with rock-hard fake nips to match her rock-hard... anyway, good news for Kayla! The school board has ruled that she can continue to live her best life around high school boys.

To recap, here's the video that rocketed Kayla to viral superstardom:

I don't remember my shop teacher looking like this🧵 pic.twitter.com/pHHr58Zspa
— Royce Lopez (@hippojuicefilm) September 14, 2022

As it turns out Kayla, who is a she, used to be a he. But as the AP Styleguide tells us, he deciding he's a she makes her a she. The problem is not everyone is open-minded like you or I am. Critics claim without evidence it's inappropriate for a dude -- even one living their best life and a lady -- to be operating heavy machinery around teenage boys with comically large fake chesticles and fake areolas that could stab someone. It's also dangerous.

Those critics say things like "we as adults are supposed to protect the children," "no normal person in their right mind would dress up like that and go teach kids," and "dude...what the f*ckity f*cking f*ck?"

The complaints went to the Halton District School Board. The Post Millennial reports board members ruled against the concerns of parents and sided with equality and inclusion. If wearing size HHH breastists makes Kayla say "damn, I feel like a woman," she can continue living her best life.

It is important to recognize the impact that dress code policies can have on members of the transgender community. Most notably, it is important for employers to make allowances to ensure that these employees are able to express themselves in accordance with their lived gender.

We here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website applaud the courage of the Halton District School Board. It takes conviction for a board of people tasked with ensuring education for the youth of the world to say "f*ck them kids." And we hope one day that Kayla Lemieux can live the life she wants to live without haters telling him who they think he is.

Editor’s Note

title: Watch: NFL's Lamar Jackson meets his biggest fan (with a heart condition), then something BEAUTIFUL happens
description:
We are finishing up a divisive election cycle (almost) and are set to enter a more divisive, two-year cycle right away. We here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website felt some content to warm your heart and make your soul feel cozy and snuggly was in order. The tall guy in this video is Lamar Jackson, quarterback for the Baltimore Ravens. The short guy is Landon, a ten-year-old from Mississippi.

Landon is Lamar's biggest fan. Landon also has a heart condition.

View this post on Instagram
A post shared by Baltimore Ravens (@ravens)

Landon was so overwhelmed meeting his childhood hero, he wouldn't let go of the hug.

The scene is so moving, I won't even make it a point to remind everyone Josh Allen is the best QB in the AFC.

Landon has a heart condition where the left side of his heart did not form correctly. ESPN reports he has needed three surgeries: at 8 days old, 2 1/2 months and 2 1/2 years. He's only ten years old now, and will need a heart transplant by the age of 20. For this brief moment, none of that mattered. What mattered to Landon was his hero, the hug, and catching passes from Jackson around the conference room table.

Landon's dad Jason said of the meeting, "Everything was just so heartfelt. It was incredible. It was absolutely incredible."

Everyone here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website will be keeping Landon in our prayers. We're also going to log off for a bit and go hug someone.

Editor’s Note

title: Kari Lake LIVE: WTF Is Going On in Arizona? (Show Notes)
description:
We have an update on where election 2022 stands, and shockingly, Arizona is a mess again. We'll hear EXCLUSIVELY from Arizona gubernatorial candidate Kari Lake! Where does the race stand now? Is she going to pull it off? Find out from Kari herself!

MISC

  • Sean Penn travels to Ukraine to give Zelinksyy his Oscar. No, really. This is a real thing that happened.

ELECTION // ARIZONA UPDATE

  • Midterms Live Updates: Congress Remains in Play as Georgia Senate Race Heads for Runoff

  • Republicans pick up 3 New York House seats with Long Island sweep and defeat of DCCC chair

  • Warnock and Walker leap into Georgia’s Senate runoff

  • 12News
  • Florida counted 98% of their votes by the end of election night.
  • What’s in Box 3? About 17,000 Maricopa County ballots that wouldn’t scan
  • Katie Hobbs Again Rejects Kari Lake's Call to Recuse Herself From Oversight of Arizona Race

title: MSNBC: Hey, you know who would make a good president? That John Fetterman guy
description:
Critics, without evidence, said the plan was to drag John Fetterman's barely cognizant body across the finish line (they do that in Pennsylvania). Then, five minutes after getting sworn in, having him announce he could not fulfill his duties "due to health reasons." His wife would then be installed as Senator. THAT plan at least makes sense.

MSNBC has a different idea. What if we ran Fetterman for president?

Fettermania is sweeping MSNBC.

They ACKSHUALLY want John Fetterman to run for president... pic.twitter.com/mKQO6r9Oh7
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) November 10, 2022

Conservatives are not above rushing someone who checks all our political boxes to higher office before they have assumed lower office. But at least when we rally behind Kari Lake for President, we can point to her ability to speak good. Fetterman lacks the ability to speak... at all.

Shout it, shout it, shout it out loud... pic.twitter.com/dMympcbYgi
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) October 27, 2022

These are the words Katy Tur let fall out of her facehole:

Fetterman as a nominee at some point for president. I know there are some variables. But what he did in the super red part of Pennsylvania, it makes you wonder?

It makes me wonder if Tur is suffering from CTE. What Fetterman accomplished was running against a horrible statewide GOP candidate who was being dragged down by a worse statewide GOP candidate. Pennslyvania had to choose between a guy who is half a vegetable and Dr. Oz. They chose the half a vegetable who looks like he can stand to eat more of them.

Is the lack of ability to communicate the one trait leftists look for in the presidential candidates? They've got Biden with Kamala in the wings. Now they are exciting themselves over Fetterman 2028: Yargle Blargle!

title: Watch: Louis Vuitton thief confuses window for a door, knocks himself out stealing $18000 worth of handbags
description:
In the olden days -- a bygone era, if you will -- thieves put some thought into their thievery. They knew the way in and the way out. Thieving was well thought out. Now, these days, in the Smash n' Grab '20s, our criminal element has no such time to do things like "think." It's all about running in, grabbing as much merch as you can get your scummy little hands-on, and praying for the best as you run out the door. Or into a window.

In the olden days, our bad guys knew the difference between doors and windows. Not in 2022. Not at this Louis Vuitton in Washington. And not this loser.

Raw Video: Man knocks himself out trying to flee store with luxury stolen goods | New York Post youtu.be

Some smash and grabbers catch hands. Some catch a bullet. This dinkus caught a concussion.

The dumbest thing in all of this? His colleagues ran out the front door while the security guard essentially held the door open for them and wished them a good day. It wasn't until they were a mile away one of them turned around and asked, "hey, what happened to Cecil?"

Cecil is lying on the floor being helped up by security. Where he will no doubt be arrested, driven to the police station, and released without bail on his own recognizance. Only the promise that he will stop stealing things that don't belong to him. Washington Police would have to have to ask him again.

title: SNL's 'comedy' writers are boycotting over Dave Chappelle hosting (let that one simmer in your brain)
description:
SNL, formally known as Saturday Night Live, is (or was) a legendary comedy show responsible for launching the careers of Eddie Murphy, Adam Sandler, and Will Farrell. Dave Chappelle, a comedian, is the best to ever do it. And the alleged "comedy" writers for SNL are BOYCOTTING THE COMEDY SHOW they write for because Chappelle is hosting.

Let that one percolate in your noggin as I quote the New York Post:

We’re told that some staff writers are so furious that the comedy superstar — who has made transphobic and homophobic jokes — has been chosen to helm the iconic show that they’re sitting out the episode.
“They’re not going to do the show,” an insider told Page Six. “But none of the actors are boycotting.”

We don't have to recap all the Chappelle "controversy" over the past few years to explain how we got to this point. Do we?

Though, to be fair. Chappelle reps told the paper there was nothing to suggest there was a boycott when they attended the writers' meeting. New York Post is also who reported that there were boycotts over Elon Musk when he was a host, due to Musk having different opinions than everyone who works on SNL.

The current comedy writers suck pretty hard at writing comedy. If the boycott is true and if I'm Dave Chappelle, I'm saying "f*ck it, I'll write it myself."

It's astounding when you think about it. We're not talking about the proverbial three idiots on Twitter with the same dumb opinion or the collection of freaks who protest outside of his shows. We're talking about COMEDY WRITERS working for (what used to be) a legendary comedy show boycotting because they are unhappy with a COMEDIAN'S jokes.

And not any comedian. It's not like they're boycotting someone Kenan Thompson saw at an open mic night tha he wants to give a big break to. They a boycotting a comedian many consider to be THE GOAT. That's funnier than any joke SNL writers will come up with.

title: Rumble announces the record-breaking success of Crowder's 2022 Midterm Election Livestream
description:

Our 2022 Midterm Election Livestream has over THREE MILLION VIEWS and counting.

BREAKING NEWS: Steven Crowder (@scrowder) has already registered over 3M+ total views on Rumble for his election coverage show last night. 🔥

We're LIVE with @DonaldJTrumpJr

I guess the only question now is, where do we go from here? Hmm...
